titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Emma Gretchen Corstvet Llewellyn was a social scientist and economics professor at Sarah Lawrence College. She received her bachelor's degree from the University of Wisconsin in 1918, and was a graduate student in Bryn Mawr College's Industrial Supervision Course in 1918-1919. She was married to Karl Llewellyn, a prominent legal scholar, from 1933 to 1946, and worked with Underhill Moore, another important legal theorist, at Yale University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal and professional papers of Emma Llewellyn. Materials include: correspondence with family, friends, and colleagues; research notes and drafts for her study of the Tennessee Valley Authority; photographs; newspaper and magazine clippings; reprints; and personal and professional letters of her husband Karl Llewellyn.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
